decks.notes: The deck focuses on using Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to power out high-cost artifacts quickly, while disrupting opponents with taxing effects like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere. It also utilizes cards like Crucible of Worlds and Wasteland to control the opponent's mana base. The deck includes a mix of mana acceleration through mana rocks like Sol Ring and Moxen, along with threats like Stonecoil Serpent and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim. The combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive artifacts makes it difficult for opponents to keep up with the deck's pace.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast, Hogaak, and Vengevine, then use cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Bazaar of Baghdad to bring them back onto the battlefield for a strong aggro strategy. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Collector Ouphe and Force of Vigor to hinder opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to support the aggro game plan with a mix of fetch lands and utility lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient creatures and disruption.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the game using powerful planeswalker cards and versatile counterspells. By using cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Dack Fayden to disrupt the opponent's game plan, along with cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast to protect your own threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolored spells and the inclusion of cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk provide powerful card advantage and tempo plays. Overall, the deck focuses on utilizing planeswalkers and counterspells to control the game and secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's resources and slow down their game plan while leveraging powerful artifacts to generate advantage and end the game quickly. By utilizing cards like Sphere of Resistance, Ensnaring Bridge, and Trinisphere to hinder the opponent's plays, as well as cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Karn, the Great Creator to search for and play impactful artifacts like Mana Crypt and Mystic Forge, this deck aims to overwhelm and outpace the opponent in a Vintage 1 vs 1 setting.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures from the library, such as Griselbrand. It also includes a variety of fast mana accelerants and card draw spells to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt opponents with counterspells and removal. The deck aims to control the game by efficiently managing resources and leveraging the powerful creatures that Oath of Druids can put into play.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful spells and creatures to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal. By utilizing efficient cards like Force of Will and Dack Fayden, it aims to control the game tempo and maintain board presence. The inclusion of cantrips and card draw spells like Brainstorm and Preordain ensures that the deck can consistently find the right answers and threats to stay ahead in the game. Jeskai Xerox excels at adapting to different matchups and adjusting its strategy accordingly to come out on top.

The deck aims to create a powerful winning combo by using cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw into artifact mana sources and combo pieces quickly. By utilizing a mix of fast mana, card draw spells, and countermagic, the deck can quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game through various win conditions such as storming off with Tendrils of Agony, or using Bolas's Citadel to cast spells off the top of the library. The key strategy is to efficiently draw cards, generate mana, and protect the combo until it can be executed for a game-winning turn.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's resources while deploying threats and card advantage. It uses a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman and Tarmogoyf to control the game. The deck also incorporates powerful Planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional value. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through card draw and efficient threats, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a well-rounded game plan that combines disruption and aggression.

The main concept of this deck is focused on utilizing powerful cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to quickly fill up the graveyard, allowing for the quick and consistent reanimation of key threats like Vengevine and Hollow One. Additionally, the deck includes plenty of disruptive spells such as Mindbreak Trap and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays while maintaining control over the game through powerful disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Sprite Dragon, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Scab-Clan Berserker while disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast. It also utilizes powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible by efficiently using its resources and leveraging its aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's resources while applying pressure with efficient threats. The deck utilizes a combination of disruptive cards like Wasteland, Assassin's Trophy, and Force of Will to control the game, while also deploying powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Leovold, and Oko to close out the game. The deck also includes some powerful card draw and selection spells to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary cards. Overall, this deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Narset, Wrenn and Six, and Dack Fayden to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes key control elements like Force of Will, Flusterstorm, and Pyroblast to counter threats and protect its own spells. The deck is designed to generate card advantage through spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise, while also applying pressure with creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dreadhorde Arcanist. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine.

The deck focuses on disruption and resource denial to control the game while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold. It combines powerful cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Assassin's Trophy to deal with threats while using disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has card advantage and selection with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Brainstorm. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent while applying pressure to win the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to generate a large amount of mana through artifacts like Moxen and Mana Crypt, then utilize cards like Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate more mana. The deck relies on powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain advantage while controlling the opponent's plays with counterspells like Force of Will. The deck also includes a small disruption package with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition through cards like Tinker or Bolas's Citadel.

The deck focuses on using the Doomsday card to set up a winning combination with Thassa's Oracle. It uses a variety of tutors, card draw spells, and counterspells to help ensure the combo is successful. The deck also includes cards like Demonic Consultation and Necropotence to help assemble the necessary cards for the combo. The mana base is optimized to support the deck's strategy, allowing for a fast and consistent setup of the win condition.

This deck focuses on controlling the battlefield with counterspells and disruption while applying pressure with efficient threats like Monastery Mentor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also aims to manipulate the top of its library with cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance to maintain card advantage and interaction with the opponent. By utilizing cards that can draw additional cards and providing a versatile suite of answers, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and overwhelm them with a combination of card advantage and tempo plays.
